markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

“Mendicants, phoenixes reproduce in these four ways. What four? Phoenixes are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously. These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.”

SN.30.2. Harantisutta (“They Carry Off”)

children.value:
“Mendicants, phoenixes reproduce in these four ways.
What four?
Phoenixes are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.”
